intro: Hirtellina fruticosa, commonly known as the hairy shrub, is a perennial plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and small, often hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Hirtellina fruticosa is typically found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
